first moves to taxi to finally come to rest.

Questions.QuestionString: What does ICAO stand for? (Level 1)

which is annex concerning to aircraft airworthiness?  (Level 1)

Any machine that can derive support in the atmosphere from the reactions of the air other than the reactions of the air against the earth’s surface

Questions.QuestionString: According to Annex 1, the licences for flight crew members other than licences for pilots are:  (Level 1)
Answers: Flight navigator licence, Flight engineer licence
Flight crew attendant licence, Flight engineer licence
Flight navigator licence, Flight crew attendant licence

Questions.QuestionString: According to Annex 1, licences and ratings for personnel other than flight crew members are:  (Level 1)
Answers: Aircraft maintenance (technician/engineer/mechanic), Air traffic controller licence, Flight operations officer/flight dispatcher licence, Aeronautical station operator licence, Aeronautical meteorological personnel
Aircraft maintenance (technician/engineer/mechanic), Aeronautical station operator licence, Aeronautical meteorological personnel
Flight operations officer/flight dispatcher licence, Aeronautical station operator licence, Aeronautical meteorological personnel

Questions.QuestionString: According to Annex 6 denifition, Aerodrome are:  (Level 1)
Answers: A defined area on land (including any buildings, installations and equipment) intended to be used either wholly or in part for the arrival, departure and surface movement of aircraft.
A defined area on land or water (including any buildings, installations and equipment) intended to be used either wholly or in part for the arrival, departure and surface movement of aircraft.
A defined area on air (including any buildings, installations and equipment) intended to be used either wholly or in part for the arrival, departure and surface movement of aircraft.

Questions.QuestionString: What is a AOC?  (Level 1)
Answers: A certificate authorizing an operator to carry out specified all air transport operations
A certificate authorizing an operator to carry out specified commercial air transport operations
A certificate authorizing an operator to carry out specified cargo air transport operations only.

Questions.QuestionString: The procedures for certification and continuing aircraft airworthiness describe in:  (Level 1)
According to Annex 8 denifition, Power-unit is :  (Level 1)
Answers: A system of one or more engines and ancillary parts which are together necessary to provide thrust, independently of the continued operation of any other owerunit(s), but not including short period thrust-producing devices.
A system of one or more engines and ancillary parts which are together necessary to provide thrust, but not including short period thrust-producing devices.

A system of one or more engines and ancillary parts which are together necessary to provide thrust, or diffirent purpose ( as APU…ect) independently of the continued operation of any other owerunit(s), but not including short period thrust-producing devices.

Questions.QuestionString: According to Annex 8 denifition, Type Certificate is :  (Level 1)
Answers: A document issued by a Contracting State to define the all type of aircraft that State is being ownned
A document issued by a Contracting State to define the design of an aircraft type and to certify that this design meets the EASA regulations.
A document issued by a Contracting State to define the design of an aircraft type and to certify that this design meets the appropriate airworthiness requirements of that State

According to denifition of Changes in type design,  What is the minor change? (Level 1)
Answers: A minor change is one that has no appreciable effect on the weight, balance, structural strength, reliability, operational characteristics. A minor change may change of noise, fuel discharge and exhaust affecting the airworthiness of the product

A minor change is one that has no appreciable effect on the weight, balance, structural strength, reliability, operational characteristics, noise, fuel discharge. A minor change may change of exhaust affecting the airworthiness of the product

A minor change is one that has no appreciable effect on the weight, balance, structural strength, reliability, operational characteristics, noise, fuel discharge and exhaust affecting the airworthiness of the product

A maintenance release shall be issued by CRS cat A, cat C

Questions.QuestionString: All airworthiness technical data used by the AMO holder be. (Level 2)

used any revision by personnel who perform their duty.

Questions.QuestionString: In a CAAV approved maintenance organisation, A Certificate of Release to Service must be retained for. (Level 2)
Answers: two years after expiry of period of validity.
two years after date of issue.
six months after date of issue.

Questions.QuestionString: The AMO holder shall have available the necessary equipment, tools, and material to perform the approved scope of work and these items shall be under full control of the AMO holder. The availability of equipment and tools means. (Level 2)
Answers: Permanent availability except in the case of any tool or equipment that is so rarely needed that its permanent availability is not necessary.
Necessary tool or equipment can be ordered during performing the related work.
Necessary tool or equipment can be rented and no need to be controlled.

Questions.QuestionString: Storage conditions. (Level 2)
Answers: Be provided security for serviceable parts, segregation of serviceable from unserviceable parts, and prevent deterioration of and damage to stored items.

Questions.QuestionString: The CAAV approved certificate for an AMO is effective for: (Level 2)

Answers: 24 calendar months after that person has ceased employment with the AMO or upon withdrawal of his or her authorisation.
12 calendar months after that person has ceased employment with the AMO or upon withdrawal of his or her authorisation.
36 calendar months after that person has ceased employment with the AMO or upon withdrawal of his or her authorisation.

Questions.QuestionString: Which following statement about a maintenance release is not correct? (Level 2)
Answers: are kept for 2 years from the release date.
shall be issued by appropriately authorised certifying staff.

Questions.QuestionString: Who issues a VAR Part 7 AMT licence? (Level 2)

Answers: initially 2 years then re­issued for a period of 5 years.
initially 5 years then re­issued for a period of 2 years.

Questions.QuestionString: A B2 AMT License allows aircraft maintenance technician to sign completion of maintenance after performing maintenance work on. (Level 2)
A VAR Part 7 maintenance license remains valid. (Level 2)
Answers: if he/she has received continuation training in the last 2 years.
if he/she has worked on aircraft for 6 months in the last 2 years.
if he/she has worked on aircraft for 4 months in the last 2 years.

Questions.QuestionString: If an engineer has an aircraft maintenance license without type rating, he/she can. (Level 2)

Questions.QuestionString: A Category A VAR Part 7 licensed engineer can certify for work carried out. (Level 2)
Answers: by anyone within an approved organisation.
by anyone, even if they are independent of an approved organisation.

Read, write, speak, and understand the Vietnamese language.
Read, write, speak, and understand the language is written on the aircraft maintenance manual.
